triples.name: Separation logic
triples.relevance: The paper extends separation logic to reason about Java programs with proper modularity support.

triples.name: Java (programming language)
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on developing local reasoning for Java and modular features like objects and abstract datatypes.

triples.name: Abstract data type
triples.relevance: The paper uses abstract datatypes as a foundation for developing abstract predicates to encapsulate state.

triples.name: Encapsulation (computer programming)
triples.relevance: The paper addresses encapsulation as a key modularity issue and proposes abstract predicates to support it.

triples.name: Inheritance (object-oriented programming)
triples.relevance: The paper extends abstract predicates to handle inheritance through abstract predicate families.

triples.name: Visitor pattern
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates the usefulness of abstract predicate families by verifying the visitor design pattern.

triples.name: Abstract predicate
triples.relevance: The paper introduces abstract predicates as a novel logical mechanism that serves as the analogue of abstract datatypes and enables state encapsulation in separation logic.
